member.name: T:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarButtonBase
member.summary: Represents the base class for all Button controls in a Calendar

member.name: F:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarButtonBase._isLoaded
member.summary: True if the control has been loaded; false otherwise.

member.summary: True if the mouse has been captured by this button, false otherwise.

member.summary: True if the SPACE key is currently pressed, false otherwise.

member.summary: True if the mouse's left button is currently down, false otherwise.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarButtonBase._mousePosition
member.summary: Last known position of the mouse with respect to this Button.

member.summary: Current visual state of the button.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarButtonBase._suspendStateChanges
member.summary: True if visual state changes are suspended; false otherwise.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ButtonBase class.

member.summary: Update the current visual state of the button.

member.summary: Change to the correct visual state for the button.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarButtonBase.ChangeVisualState(System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard)
member.summary: Change the visual state of the button.
member.param: Next visual state of the button.
member.remarks: This method should not be called by controls to force a change to the current visual state. UpdateVisualState is preferred because it properly handles suspension of state changes.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Controls.Slider
member.summary: Slider control lets the user select from a range of values by moving a slider. Slider is used to enable to user to gradually modify a value (range selection). Slider is an easy and natural interface for users, because it provides good visual feedback.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.DoubleUtil
member.summary: A collection of helper methods for working with double data types

member.name: F:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.DoubleUtil.Epsilon
member.summary: Epsilon is the smallest value such that 1.0+epsilon != 1.0. It can be used to determine the acceptable tolerance for rounding errors.
member.remarks: Epsilon is normally 2.2204460492503131E-16, but Silverlight 2 uses floats so the effective epsilon is really 1.192093E-07

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.DoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determine if the two doubles are effectively equal within tolerances
